meanings.definition: Belonging exclusively or confined to a particular place
meanings.sent1: The rare flower was endemically found only in the deep forest.
meanings.sent2: The species of bird is endemically native to this island.
meanings.sent3: The endemically shy squirrel refused to come out of its tree.
meanings.sent4: Her love for painting was endemically rooted in her childhood memories.
meanings.sent5: The endemically cold weather made it difficult to grow certain plants in the region.

meanings.definition: Characteristic of a particular population or region
meanings.sent1: The traditional dance was endemically performed by the local community.
meanings.sent2: The architecture of the buildings was endemically influenced by the culture of the area.
meanings.sent3: The endemically loud parrot surprised everyone with its sudden silence.
meanings.sent4: His endemically calm demeanor helped him navigate through the chaos.
meanings.sent5: The endemically spicy cuisine delighted the taste buds of visitors.

meanings.definition: Prevalent in a particular area or group
meanings.sent1: The flu was endemically spreading among the school children.
meanings.sent2: The endemically high crime rate in the neighborhood concerned the residents.
meanings.sent3: The endemically late bus caused frustration among the commuters.
meanings.sent4: Her endemically positive attitude uplifted the spirits of those around her.
meanings.sent5: The endemically vibrant culture of the city attracted tourists from far and wide.
